image.altText: An armoured vehicle is pictured on a dark street as people are looking at it.

items.synopsis: The boss of Russian mercenary groupÂ Wagner says his troops will go "all the way" against Russia's military. Follow live.

title.children: Prigozhin says his fighters are 'ready to die' as Wagner forces allegedly enter Russian town

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Reuters has reported that video on a pro-Wagner Group Telegram channel shows Yevgeny Prigozhin talking to top Russian generals in what the social media post says is the district military headquarters in Rostov-on-Don. Prigozhin says on the video his men will blockade Rostov-on-Don and head for Moscow unless the country's defence chiefs Shoigu and Gerasimov come to them.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Wagner Group head threatens to blockade Rostov-on-Don after reportedly taking control of city's military HQ

pro-Wagner Group

Prigozhin says on the video his men will

and

unless the country's defence chiefs Shoigu and Gerasimov come to them.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's just gone past 6am in Moscow, and the ABC's Global Affairs Editor, John Lyons, says Vladimir Putin has a debacle on his hands. "He'll be in hiding," he says. "There are several doubles, lookalikes of Putin, as we know. They will be working full time, I suspect, in the next few days. "... They've built entire premises underground, where he can survive for weeks and months. "I don't think we'll see a sign of him, the real Putin, for some time, because this is a real crisis for him. "This day dawning in Moscow now is the toughest day he's going to have faced for a long time."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: It's morning in Moscow and Putin is facing a huge challenge, Lyons says

props.alt: A bald middle-aged white man in glasses and a suit gestures with his hands while speaking in a TV news studio

children.content: (ABC News)
It's just gone past 6am in Moscow
, and the ABC's Global Affairs Editor, John Lyons, says Vladimir Putin has a debacle on his hands.
"He'll be in hiding," he says.
"There are several doubles, lookalikes of Putin, as we know. They will be working full time, I suspect, in the next few days.
"... They've built entire premises underground, where he can survive for weeks and months.
"I don't think we'll see a sign of him, the real Putin, for some time, because this is a real crisis for him.
"This day dawning in Moscow now is the toughest day he's going to have faced for a long time."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the chief of mercenary group Wagner, says his 25,000-strong force is "ready to die" as he vows to challenge Russia's military leadership. "All of us are ready to die. All 25,000, and then another 25,000," he says in a new audio message. "We are dying for the Russian people."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Wagner chief says his 25,000 mercenaries are 'ready to die'

props.alt: A close up of a bald middle-aged white man in a jumper and jacket, oudoors

children.content: (AP)
Yevgeny Prigozhin, the chief of mercenary group Wagner, says his 25,000-strong force is "ready to die" as he vows to challenge Russia's military leadership.
"All of us are ready to die. All 25,000, and then another 25,000," he says in a new audio message. "We are dying for the Russian people."
